name: Marriott Indianapolis Downtown

reviews.text: I had only one complaint about this hotel, but it's a major one, especially for business travelers. The Wi-Fi in the room did not work. It was either out altogether, or when it was on it was so slow as to be worthless. I had to go to the lobby to send emails. And as I was there for business meetings, that was a significant inconvenience. I reported the problem to the front desk without result. No improvement in service. No follow-up with me. Aside from that, it was a nice hotel in a good location with friendly staff and nice amenities. It has a lot going for it, but I would not stay there again unless I could be convinced that they have come to understand the need to provide reliable WiFi/Internet service for business travelers.
reviews.title: Good in Every Way But One

reviews.text: From the minute I stepped out of the taxi the service was excellent!
reviews.title: Friendly and clean!!

reviews.text: The ladies at the front desk were really nice and helpful when checking in.
reviews.title: Great stay
Excellent!
reviews.text: No free wi-fi in the rooms only in the lobby. $15 for 24 hour use of wi-fi...ouch!
The room is beautiful, clean and I got a great view!
reviews.title: Great location to all the action!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 6 nights with a number of my colleagues for a conference. Good central location and just across the street from the convention centre. I had a nice, clean and big room. Some of my colleagues were as satisfied as me, but there were quite a number that I know that have rather high standards and wanted something more luxurious. This place would be a step above Holiday Inn but not up to luxury standards apparently. So taste is all relative. But the staff was welcoming, the hotel meeting rooms were nice and the food was generally good. Only warning would be that if you are a light eater at breakfast, you might want to skip the main restaurant. It is a buffet breakfast and you might get a hefty bill for just a coffee and toast.
reviews.title: Good solid hotel as long as you are not a hotel snob

reviews.text: The hotel is very conveniently located. Next to the convention center and close to Lucas Oil stadium. Lots of restaurants and activity within walking distance. Only negative is the cost of parking. $30 for self-park and $35 for valet per day. However, there is a lot right next store on the west side where self-park is only $15/day.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.text: We had our annual Smart Girl Summit here this year from 8/9 and 8/10. The hotel is beautiful, the ballroom for our meetings was awesome and the staff was very helpful. Biggest problem with this hotel...they nickel and dime you to death. There is an extra charge for everything. Parking, internet access, essentials.
reviews.title: Convention Stay

reviews.text: I stayed here at the end of April for the FDIC expo and my stay was very pleasant. The rooms were comfortable and well-kept and the staff was friendly, especially when it came time to leave. I parked in the underground carpark and a co-worker used his company card to pay for the parking since I didn't have one and the front desk and parking garage staff could not have been more helpful in making this rather unusual situation go so smoothly. I can't say enough about the staff's helpfulness and I would stay here again based solely on that fact.
reviews.title: Convention Stay

reviews.text: The hotel's location is excellent if you're in town for a convention or Colts game, even in winter as there are covered walkways that connect the Marriott to the ICC and Lucas Oil Stadium. Very convenient.
reviews.title: Convention Stay
Friendly Staff
reviews.text: During the 4 days I stayed here, never did I experience a bad occasion with the staff. Super friendly and always willing to go the extra mile for you. The concierge, after recommending a restaurant for dinner, surprised us by ordering our dessert. Obviously, something we did not expect or even imagined; however, super thankful as it was delicious!

reviews.title: A wonderful Hotel with a great Lounge
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, a little outdated, comfortable. One thing that surprised me, the lamps near the bed did not have alternative plugs to charge electronics. Lamps like these are very popular in other hotels, so I was disappointed when I realized I had to leave my iPad/iPhone at the desk instead of the nightstand. The elevators are in need of a "facelift". Good thing is that they are not as slow as they appear to be. The views from your room may be amazing. Be sure to get a room from the 10th floor or higher. A nice sights to see from your room first thing in the morning awaits.

I stayed here in March, and I must say I enjoyed this hotel! The hotel is located next to some great dining options including Italian, Sushi, Steak, and American. If you are not in the mood for any of those options, the employees are willing to help. The concierge lounge seems to take up almost an entire floor, and the food offerings are top notch. The lounge attendent took note that I was there all week and made sure to save me food for when I came in on the afternoons! What a great service attendent she was.
reviews.title: nice room... too crowded

reviews.text: as a Marriott Platinum rewards member I was provided an executive suite with club level access - very nice room and club. the hotel was absolutely mobbed with conventioners, so the facility seemed a little 'busy' (and not in a good way)! Champions was a nice place for a beer and lunch.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service and Professionalism.

reviews.text: Our company stays at this property 10-15 times per year, hosting a minimum of thirty people and I must say, the front desk staff and valet are some of the best in the business. It's consistent service, visit after visit is a welcome breath of fresh air. Always a clean room with any and all requests met. You can never go wrong staying at this property.
reviews.title: very nice hotel in the heart of the city
Great Marriott Property
reviews.text: This property would be great for family, business or any reason to stay in downtown. Location is great, staff were very friendly and helpful and this is a totally new Marriott design with upgraded décor, nice restaurants (good breakfast buffet), great lobby space, Starbucks on property and more! Would recommend anyone stay here.

reviews.title: Convention Hotel that keeps you fresh
reviews.text: If you like conference rooms that make you feel like you are in a freezer, this is the convention hotel for you. ;) While the internet in the conference rooms are not stable enough for today's conventions, once you are in your room, life gets better. They offer HBO, Sports channels and a good range of TV channels. The beds are comfortable and the views over the city are wonderful. Elevators seem to be smarter than in other hotels. They are fast and always there when you need them. Sport stadiums and great stores are all in walking distance. The staff is great. They keep eye contact to understand if you need something. This was a great stay.

reviews.title: Great downtown location
reviews.text: We stayed here on a business trip and found it was in the perfect location to access where we needed to be for work, and also very close to restaurants and shopping downtown. It is nice that this hotel has their own parking garage, as some hotels in the city do not and you are stuck having to park away from your hotel. First impression was the hotel was very nice, great lobby and looks very new. The rooms also look new but there are definite signs that this is an older hotel, like the bathrooms. Overall a good hotel I would stay at again.

reviews.title: Good convention choice
reviews.text: Stayed for a week-long convention. Beds in guest room very comfy, clean and well maintained. Not the newest hotel around but they seem to keep it updated. The meeting rooms were always setup well, the staff was friendly and the convention food was fine (about what you would expect for "banquet" food). I wish it was a little closer to the main downtown area for walking, but it wasn't bad at all. Shower was good and bathroom was roomy. Elevators also plentiful and pretty quick. Bell staff very friendly. Fitness Center pretty good and equipped with benches, dumbbells, and Lifetime Fitness equipment. I didn't visit the pool.

reviews.title: Convenient location, excellent service
reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference. Impressed by great, walkable downtown location. Walk to sports, museums, capitol, restaurants, canal and more. Friendly, helpful staff. Good conference meals and excellent banquet service! Nice workout room and pool. Clean comfortable rooms. Would stay here again!

description: The Indianapolis Marriott Downtown is connected via skywalk to the Convention Center and Circle Center Mall, just steps from Lucas Oil Stadium and Victory Field, and a short walk to Conseco Field House. It is also home to two on-site restaurants. Guest rooms at the hotel feature luxurious linens, a mini-fridge, and functional work areas. Just 8 miles from the airport, this property also features an indoor pool, whirlpool, and fitness room.
